column2: The best Farmers Market in LA!
column3: This is a great spot for locals to shop every Sunday morning. The second oldest farmers market in LA County, I personally think it’s the best one bar none. Four full city blocks of fresh baked breads, an astounding array of organic fruits, vegetables, legumes, dairy and meat products, plus a wild array of crafts. Some of the best buskers as well playing everything from bluegrass to jazz. Great people watching. Great place to come for breakfast or lunch. A place where you get to know your farmer as well as your neighbors!
Hollywood Farmers Market was a curious mix of items on offer, some very tasty and needed more time to fully explore, well worth a visit.

column2: If you like food you will love it
column3: Always try time for a visit to many to write about you will find food for every taste very diverse. Pizza at Patsy’s for us this time

column2: Sunday crowds and a Casual, Friendly Atmosphere
column3: Lots of food to be had here. There are many vendors preparing meals, so it's a great venue for trying new dishes that catch your eye. There are many offerings that would appear exotic to first time visitors, but it appeared most people knew exactly what they wanted and expected something wonderful. There were fresh shellfish being shucked, Indian tandori, Korean, French macarons, Mexican dishes, organic fruit & vegetables, nuts, berries, honey, and both a blues performer wailing on his harmonica and a bluegrass group plucking mandolins and banjos. Visiting this weekly event is a nice way to spend a Sunday morning.

I’ve been to a lot of different markets here, and this is by far the largest and the best. There is always a great selection of fruits and vegetables, as well as numerous food vendors. We will come out and eat breakfast or lunch before shopping.

My wife and I stopped here for a lunch break as part of a LA Day Tour. Totally amazing place with plenty of food vendors and places to eat. The larger market itself was too big to walk around in our allotted time but looked very large and impressive. Hard to believe this is in the middle of a heavily populated area.We ate at Magee’s and had Corned Beef & Roast Beef sandwiches which were delicious.We enjoyed the market and would happily return to see more.

We were overwhelmed with so much wonderfulness. The number of vegan booths was exciting as well as the varieties of organic fruits and vegetables. The food choices are abundant, including vegan coissant.
It may have been close to closing time, and they may have had limited food choices. However, I do not regret eating one amazing Hot Dog and fresh Fries from Charlie’s! What a meal!

column2: One of the best in Los Angeles. Lots of choices.
column3: Lots of choices for just about everything. Sometimes prices can be a bit high. But you know the food is fresh and you are supporting small growers. Not only do you find fruits and veggies, but nuts, baked goods, prepared foods, raw seafoods, and flowers. Great honey too. That was big on my list today.

We called in here for lunch between a trip to Rodeo Drive and the Hollywood Sign. There was a variety of places to choose from for most budgets. I visited in 1982 as a school girl and was happy to see the familiar clock tower. You can now visit the adjoining The Grove shopping mall. Most shops are higher end. There is a Cheesecake Factory in the centre of the mall.

I'm from Chicago; we can't grow citrus here and in early April, when we visited, it was still in the 30s at home. I go to farmer's markets a lot at home and was really impressed by this one! Our AirBNB host told us about it; it was right down the street from where we were staying but I wouldn't have known to look for it otherwise. It is about 4 blocks or so worth of vendors and there are places to get a meal too, not just produce. I bought a passion fruit, something else that does not grow at home! There was a great assortment of fruit and veg, many varieties of oranges, lemons and other citrus I'd never heard of, and the vendors I spoke to were all friendly and eager to talk about what they grow. I so wish we had this at home!
Haven't been here in over a year. My girlfriend and I are having a great time walking around, eating good food, people watching, and drinking espresso. We can stay here all day.

column2: Somewhat crowded, lots of food and gift-shops
column3: nice overall, visited this location and the grove, very different feel and vibe (both fine, the grove is more on the expensive side)Not too many options, so if you're seeing the grove, take a look at the market as well.
so much to eat is really a nice place to visit and get a feeling of LA lifeloved walking around and seeing the beautiful colors and trying the delicious food

column2: You will be spoilt for choices
column3: The farmers market has a variety of businesses something like a 'Pasar Malam' in Singapore's context where farmers and hawkers gather to provide an array of food and to sell their produce from their farms.

column2: Part of Our LA Day Tour
column3: We visited here as part of our LA day bus tour. Really interesting market, and history. Great places to eat.

column2: High prices, great products and good vendors
column3: Know prices before you shop here and compare between vendors. We saw blood oranges for example anywhere from $2.50 to $4.00 a poundSome amazing varieties of products, super friendly vendors and lots of samples to be had.Absolutely worth visiting when in town!
Very fun place to look around and eat. Everything from Chinese to Korean bbq and ribs. Sweets galore to. Celeb spotting fun also.

column2: A must do if your in Hollywood on a Sunday!
column3: We love this FM, it is better that LA and OC by a landslide. Great variety and fresh produce. Be sure to find the sourdough bread guy!

Make sure you hungry when you visit, because there is loads of delicious food to choose from. All sorts of lovely goodies to buy. Suggest you set a few hours aside to allow for a good wander around, because it takes ages to decide what to eat as there is so much choice! Whilst in the area take a stroll through The Grove which is right next door, a lovely pedestrian mall area.

column2: Lovely way to spend dinner or lunch hour
column3: There is a variety of different kinds of food. Most of them are tasty but my favorite thing is that you can pick from loads of different cuisines. It’s a fun place to visit and spend time with your loved ones.

column2: The best farmers markets in this universe
column3: Being a bit of a foodie I have seen many markets in Europe and the US and I have never been even close to the quality I experienced today.Approx 80 stalls with few repeat offerings. The number of samples offered filled me up for the rest of the day and freshness and overall quality was outstanding.A must visit by anyone who does not eat to survive

This is, I believe, the biggest and best Farmers Market in the greater Los Angeles area. The variety of food available is astounding, as are the people from all walks of life who shop here. I've even seen celebrity chefs!

column2: Pleasant way to spend lunch hour
column3: We were dropped off here for an hour lunch during a city tour. It was a Thursday and not very busy. We really enjoyed relaxing under the shady awning and eating our pizza lunch. There were lots of options of food we could have picked from. We also got some kettle corn, which was the best. It was a highlight of our day to eat there in the pleasant outdoor surroundings.

column2: Worth a visit even if only for food!
column3: Visited with a friend on a Sunday morning. Bustling and friendly environment.Had a huge lunch for a decent price (best I've had), and a little wander round the shops.Sure, everything is pretty expensive but what do you expect? Great little couple of hours out. Would definitely recommend a visit whilst you're in LA!
Tasty food. Reasonable prices. Great meat cuts. Right next to great shopping at the Grove. Can stop for a cold one or mussels and French wine.

Awesome farmer's market, could have wandered around here forever. I picked up some dates that were absolutely delicious. Go for breakfast, there's tons of options to choose from. Everyone was friendly and the prices were reasonable.

The Farmer’s Market is a foodie’s delight. There are so many stalls of so many kinds of different foods there! But, the place is not just for foodies. The market has a happy buzz, and you can sit and enjoy a drink or an ice cream - whatever you fancy - while indulging in a bit of people watching. A couple of hours should be good enough here. There are some souvenir shops there as well, with interesting, typically touristy stuff. Do check the timings for the market before heading there, as there are different closing timings on weekends and weekdays. The Grove, an outdoor mall with great eating options is right next to this, and you can easily club a visit to both the places.

The moment you step into the market you feel the buzzz.The chatter from the throngs of people seated,queueing,looking and the smell of good glorious food just hits you.There is an overload of all your senses.A first time experience for us n it won’t be our last.

column2: Don’t waste your time if you’ve actually been to a farmers market
column3: Maybe the Ohio selections of the north market in Columbus or West Side Market in Cleveland or La Boqueria of Barca (I’m sure there are other great ones around the country and world) have set my proverbial bar but this was painfully underwhelming. Food and market items were good but not nearly the selection I expected. Reviews suggested it was a destination; just didn’t get there for me.
You can get it all here....fresh organic produce, all kinds of prepared food, all kinds of wares and goods, live music, great people watching.....love it!

column2: A feast for the eyes as well as the stomach
column3: The Hollywood Farmers’ Market is held 8-1 every Sunday.Following on-line advice, we had only a light breakfast at home, drove to the market area and parked, and were walking among the stalls by around 8:15 a.m. It was a pleasantly cool May morning, and the market wasn’t crowded.We looked at the various food stalls selling take-away cooked food, but along the way, we sampled so many kinds of cheese, jam, and fruit that we hardly needed to buy anything for breakfast.The food for sale is fresh and reasonably priced. Regular customers come with small wagons and load them up with a mountain of purchases.I like farmers’ markets. This is one of the best I’ve ever been to, in terms of the range of food available and the quality of what was being sold. Most of the vendors urge customers to sample before buying.We stayed about two hours, strolling up and down the streets, nibbling, and making purchases. We capped off the morning with a great ice cream sandwich from a food truck near the entrance to the market area that’s near Trader Joe’s.

column2: Was OK but lacked atmosphere and ambience
column3: Many shops and eateries and lot's of people visiting but it seemed to lack a real atmoshere.There we not typical market spruikers, buskers or music playing but overall it was OK.

This is a must place to visit in LA! It is a landmark of the city since 1934 and it is a place where you can find over a 100 different food options, including markets and diversity. The possibilities are just too many to enjoy them all in one trip.From a French restaurant in the vicinity of its special grocery to any kind of American comfort food, even crepes, mexican, oriental food, desserts on any kind and probably my favorite, different kinds of fruits of different nations to enjoy. There is even a shoe store! For sure you will find something that will make you want to come back. Don't miss it!
It is rare to find good, real Mexican antojitos in LA. The hollywood farmers market has them. Make sure you bring cash and get the esquites or elotes.

Open on Sunday’s only, this is a cool place to wander through and grab something to eat in Hollywood. Lots of fresh produce available also and some boutique like stalls. I’d recommend it, take cash and enjoy.

Stumbled upon the market. A lot of local foods and fresh food. Great place to go on a sunny day. The tamales were great. And there is fresh ice cream and homemade lemonades. Stop by if you get a chance. The Hollywood Wall of Fame is nearby too.
The market is large with many stores and many different cuisines. We had Chinese and it was very good. You go to your favorite food shop make a purchase and then sit outside to eat and people watch.

Visited this place while doing tour from cruise to airport our guide said follow your nose,he was right,food from everywhere to suit every taste,decent prices also really interesting place to people watch,didn't really have enough time to go all round surrounding areas but for foodies this is worth a look

After seeing the farmers market on Food Network we added this to our must visit list when we were going to be in Los Angeles. We went here for lunch after our visit to the Grove. Great place for people watching and dozens of choices to eat. Every type of food and drink option imaginable and reasonably priced. Most places only accept cash so plan accordingly. Seating was difficult to find but worth the search.
Visited here as part of our day tour of LA.Lots of variety and brilliant quality. We was spoilt for choice.Some good shopping around too.

I really wanted to spend more time here but it was just too damn hot. There’s no air flow between the tents but there’s lots of food and neat stuff to see if you have a couple of hours to spend. Check it out... in the morning before it gets too hot and too busy!

column2: Vast array of produce, mixed with high value "trendy" shops.
column3: Densely packed food stalls, with a precinct of name outlets cheek by jowl. Interesting, an attraction for tourists and locals alike.

We visited this market as part of our Los Angeles city tour there was many stalls many food outlets we chose a Singapore noodle stall great food great price rest of the market was ok more to see round about the market but didn't have time

This is more of a boutique gathering for than a Farmers Market.That said, this is Hollywood California and production is the name of the game.You won't find good prices or farmers selling their wares here.
Overall good atmosphere. Good choices of food and deserts and other things. Parking was expensive like 2 dollars for 15 min so plan ahead.
Its a great outdoor street market from the local farmers and good for nice organic shopping at good rates.
Great place to walk around with mouth watering food all over the placeAnytime any food available for coffee lunch or dinnerA must when in L.A.

So many wonderful options! Food, soap, nuts, honey, live plants, flowers, fruits and vegetables, hot food, beverages, goat cheese, regular cheese, music (live and for purchase) - anything and everything you would want is here!The vendors are proud of their products and love to talk about them. Some have samples available. Parking was surprisingly easy.Would definitely return here!

We visited this Market during taking a day trip to the city. I loved this place. Awesome food stalls with all kinds of cuisines. One can shop for nice souvenirs too. Some good shops too can be seen here.
This place is outdoors with a roof and ots of seating and tons of restaurants,so everyone can enjoy what they like.
Lots of different foods available, it's a nice place to browse and pass some time doing some people watching and getting some food

column2: Farmers market tied to a shopping mall
column3: Strange mix, there is a farmers market, but there is also a high end shopping mall. If you like shopping you will like this. The location is distinct from other site seeing locations and not really a close match to the surrounding neighborhood. It is an interesting mix.
This place is just great during afternoon to visit. Nice place to find different set of food with Chinese, Mexican, Italian and many more. If you are a foodie then must visit place in CA for lunch.

It's called a "Farmers Market" but it's more like a fairground foodcourt. I didn't see any Farmers selling produce lol! However, there are lots of cool places to eat featuring many different kinds of food. Everything is jammed into a fairly small space and it's kind of cool to walk around checking out all the various vendors, and looking at menus, etc. Of course the usual tourist souveniers and trinkets etc are available.Parking was tough to find but eventually I found a spot in a parking garage. It wasn't too expensive compared to other places I've parked at in LA.The "Market" is kind of buried in the outdoor mall area. You have to look for it, but I enjoyed looking around. Back outside of the market there is the outdoor mall area that features plenty of shopping and several restaurants like Mixology, Cheesecake Factory, Marmalade Cafe, and a few others.I'd definitely return to the Market and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun way to spend a few hours.

We happened upon the farmers market waiting for a show at the Pantages. We were surprised by how large the farmers market was and the variety and excellent food types available. The dining options were very good and varied also.

Was staying in the area and visited on Sunday morning. Only wish I needed to do my weekly fruit and veg shopping! Loads of wonderful looking produce, lots of folks there stocking up. A great scene and very friendly stall holders. Had a lovely coffee and soaked up the atmosphere.

We planned our visit to the Hollywood Farmers Market to coincide with lunchtime. We came hungry and no one in our party of seven was dissapointed. There are so many vendor stalls with numerous food choices including seafood, Chinese, BBQ, pizza, Mexican, deli, ice cream, donuts, candy, etc. Everything that we tried was very good. Just be forewarned that not all stalls accept debit or credit cards, so bring some cash.There is a lovely, car-free shopping district behind the Hollywood Farmers Market. It is a beautiful area with a trolley that you can ride the length of the promenade and a delightful fountain area. We enjoyed our visit to the Farmers Market and look forward to coming again when on holiday in the Los Angeles area.
We enjoyed this experience! Neat to see so many options for food all under one area. Hubby and i grabbed a beer...Kids grabbed pizza...Everyone was happy.

This market is a must for anyone that enjoys cooking seasonal foods, and does not mind crowds of people from all walks of life. You will see many colorful characters while browsing the best collection of vendors in Los Angeles. Keep an eye on your belongings, pay no attention to the rude hipsters and your visit will be well worth the effort!
Stopped here for an hour when on a day tour of LA. Great number of interesting shops and lots of yummy food stalls and restaurants. Wish I had more time.

column2: We loved this area, a must see
column3: Our tour guide mentioned the Farmers Market, to be honest we had never heard of this place; we were in for a treat.We had an hour here as part of our tour, maybe four or five times longer would have been better. A very vibrant place, lively, fun and something for everyone. The choices of food are mind boggling, the shopping is something for everyone, and the people are open and friendly.A must do location with something for everyone.

Great people watching....very pricey....but wonderful vendors offering all the organic fruits and veggies one could ask for..plus grass fed bison (a must try)...an oyster bar ($2 each) and excellent music from jazz blues a ninja singer and a remarkable young gal who looks about 16 belting out some amazing tunes...def check out this musical talent.Hollywood and Vine is now a fun,safe destination.Who would have thunk !!!
Great area to be outdoors on a cool LA night. Lots of delicious food and snack vendors. Fun place to people watch. Don't forget to bring cash.

column2: A little oasis of good food in the metropolitan sprawl of LA
column3: Attended here not knowing what to expect but having heard of it through newspapers and books. Great market( not cheap) with lots of stalls selling uniformly good food, on a Sunday it was full of locals enjoying a Sunday stroll and food, you could do a lot worse in LA. A particular favourite was the afogato served in a chocolate lined waffle cup.

column2: Freshness in the heart of Hollywood!
column3: Wonderful California produce, herbs, flowers and even variety meats at this giant farmers market. Some pricier than others but great place to pick up fresh food for your stay in California. If I lived here I would come every week! Wish their hours ran a little later than 1pm. Great find!!

If you are unsure of what to eat, go here. They have stalls and stalls of different types of food. Mexican, deli, seafood, sweets, ...just about anyting you want. We went to Phil's Deli. Overstuffed New York style sandwiches for $10-12.
I don't know of any other Farmer's Market that allows you to sample the products! Anything that's edible, the vendor will allow you to taste it. Amazing!
This used to be the No.1 tourist destination in LA.But is definitely worth a visit as it has a fantasic selection of food, fresh produce and restaurants.All under cover and most reasonably priced.

column2: Just a market, don't know what all the fuss is about?!
column3: We went here today after reading the reviews, however were disappointed. If you've ever been to any market, then you don't need to go here, it's just a market, nothing special. I can't see what the fuss is about, there's various market food (90% of the stalls sell food) and a few tourist 'junk' stalls, nothing you can't get anywhere else. It's also pretty small, don't expect to spend long here.The only good part was the outside mall which is across the road, that's quite nice and scenic, but again, if you've been to a mall before, then don't expect anything different.We honestly thought we'd gone to the wrong place but viewed the photos on trip advisor and we were in the right place. I wouldn't recommend going here at all unless you've never been to a market before, and to be honest, if this is your first market you'll be pretty disappointed.
If you want food...you got it. If you want shopping...you got it. If you want a beautiful oasis in the midst of dingy Hollywood, you got it. Great place to visit clearly the best stop in LA.
A brilliant morning spent here,lots of good quality fresh food,to buy and eat.Very enjoyable,not to be missed

column2: Don't go hungry - unless you are rich
column3: I really miss this place. The meats, and cheeses, and fruit. California in general has amazing fruit. If you are staying someplace with a kitchen, it's great to stock up here. I particularly liked the fresh chorizo and sausages. Be aware of how much you're spending though. It can add up.
We had a full day in Los Angeles on our way back from Mexico. We went to the farmers market and it was well worth it. A fun place. Shopping, food everywhere.

I love visiting the Hollywood Farmers market and buying the freshest fruits and veggies the vendors grow themselves. It can be a little expensive so make sure to walk the whole market. And it is a large farmers market. Buy what is in season! The colors and atmosphere are terrific. Everyone is in a good mood. Great photo ops. Street parking at meters available but may take some time to find. No dogs allowed. Food trucks on site. Not just veggies and fruit. You'll find olive oil, bakeries vending, flowers, cheese, seafood etc.

This area is a nice place to visit and browse for a few hours. It's a market style area combined with some shops. Many food stalls inside to choose from. Tourist souvenir stands and shops are located in the area.

column2: Great Spot for Lunch and Snacks
column3: This is a hidden gem. So many little shops to buy flowers, fruit, candy and all variety of prepared food. A must see. Only wish we had more time to explore the shopping.

We stopped here for lunch. There are many eateries and you are spoilt for choice. There is no Indian food though! Fresh fruit is available everywhere. Do stop by during your tour. There are clean rest rooms too.

So many different types of food to eat. After we were done eating, we saw so many other places we wish we would have ate at but we were so full. I suggest you want around the place first before you decide what you are hungry for.

Great day to be had, browsing the various food stands. Loved it and can't wait to go back. You can venture from the Original Market into the modern area, and spend hours enjoying the atmosphere, dining, drinking wine, browsing the bookstore, riding the carriage - great family day out.

I love this farmers market. They have more organic fruits and vegetables did any of the other farmers markets I have attended in Los Angeles and even more choices organic than Whole Foods Markets. They have seafood, bison, grass fed beef, flowers, food trucks, huge assortment of bakery goods, and a guy who is there every week selling a variety of pesto sauces. The only better pesto sauce I remember is in Genoa, Italy. I can even buy plants at this farmers market, and grow my own organic herbs. And there is music in every corner of the four blocks - some local musicians playing for spare change. It's rain or shine, Sundays until 1 PM.

Many locals will fill the streets to grab the freshest heirloom tomato or foraged mushrooms. That of course doesn't mean a tourist shouldn't check out this wonderful market of delights! It is a fantastic way to see how the neighbors live and get a taste of the diverse city at your hotel.

Enjoyable way to walk off your excesses of Saturday night. Unbelievable bounty compared to the farmers markets I've seen on the East Coast. Lots of organic as well as Asian specialties. Not a lot of choices for walk-away foods to eat while strolling but an enjoyable way to spend a half hour or more on a Sunday morning, especially if you are a foodie or into gardening.

column2: Fun Sunday at the local market!
column3: In town for the first time and was taken to the Hollywood Farmers Market - coming from the east coast in February, it's so cool to see what's available on the west coast at this time of year, Lots of oranges, strawberries, as well as lettuce, mushrooms - you name it!

column2: Iconic, eclectic and definitely worth a visit
column3: The Farmers Market has been around forever, but has gradually morphed into an interesting collection of eating places as opposed to all-out produce stand. It's still the mostly wooden and stucco buildings that have been there for 50+ years and you can still buy some beautiful fruits, vegetables and meats, but there are also many food speciality kiosks, one or two souvenir stores and a ton of interesting restaurants and/or food stands. We spent an interesting two hours walking around looking before having a great lunch at a French restaurant (Monsieur Marcel's). We watched a TV news crew film a segment at the Brazilian food stand that was dolled up for Mardi Gras--including poodles in couture and beads. A small band was on hand to entertain customers. Bought some spectacular oranges for dessert at another stand close by. There is good parking that is free with a ticket validation. The market is about a mile from the LA County Art Museum, so a great place to lay up after art peeping.We'll keep going back to this LA/Hollywood institution Let's hope it doesn't get swallowed by developers.

column2: A great place to feed a group
column3: Such a fun place to wander, shop, and eat, eat and eat. So many different selections in a fun location.It would be easy for folks its varied tastes to enjoy a meal together with some great people watching.

This was a fun place to visit. Even on a rainy cold day we enjoyed it. Various foods you can try and little stores to mooch around. We enjoyed lunch here and I'd recommend it as a relaxing place to visit.

A nice (busy) place to shop... a wonderful place to people watch... and a great place to pick up some "Caveman" Blue Cheese!!! I love a good blue cheese and this ranks in my top 3!!! Please don't ask me to pair it with any wine but I think a nice Francis Coppola Chardonnay would be nice!!! ;-) These pictures were taken by my wonderful wife, thank you Julie!!!

The Hollywood Farmers Market is one of the very few real things in dear old Hollywood and it's quite enjoyable. Don't eat beforehand as you'll definitely find a delicious something special meal at one of the vendors. Has a nice relaxed feel to it and everyone is having fun shopping, browsing or jus exploring. We pop up to the Market a couple of times a year because it's really enjoyable! Have fun. ...
A lot of different restaurants to choose from. Nothing too good though. Fried everything. There might be a few gems in there but they must be really hard to find.

column2: Farmers Market with a California Twist
column3: This place is an organized labyrinth of Stall and cabins with an incredible selection of international food.Communal seating areas make it easy to have different foods shared by friends and families.The area is very safe and parking is a breeze.Just up the road from it is the Mall shopping area where you can walk from shop to shop but be careful you do not get run over by the Tram!

Wide variety of items from prepared foods and fresh produce. Wished we could have visited longer. Also, wished we could take foods back home on the plane. It's in the heart of Hollywood and a nice escape from some of the tourist traps.

On our whole trip the California we visited a few different famers markets. This one was by far the best. The best selection, variety of items. We bought some amazing bread and nuts. Need one of these markets close to me for sure!

column2: For a relaxed Sunday am stroll
column3: Primarily fruit and vegetable stands. When I visited there was only a single fishmonger, don't recall any butchers. Single florist. One or two cheese stands. Number of street singers sprinkled throughout. Not a large farmer's market, very walkable. Great way to spend a relaxed Sunday am, do a bit of people watching, grab a bite or two, and some fresh fruits and vegetables.

This is the place for reasonable food and shopping. We had a very good meal and did some shopping. Wish we had more time because the shopping was rushed but we'll definitely come back only saw a small piece of it. Even my teenagers liked it.Ok I did buy all 3 new hats and my daughter sunglasses. So call me a cheater.They still had fun!!!!

This a Great place to meet your friends or come solo to get everything,one of my best stop's , Was @The Bernard Ranches booth in front of the Library on Ivar. It was Totally Amazing ! V. Bernard "the grower" grows w/ Seaweed (kelp)..This make's everything taste wonderful & all Natural !also next door is the J & J OnlyDaughters Ranch ! Awesome place as well ! Great avocado's and everything else under the moon ! All Grown W/ much Love & All Natural

column2: Neat place with lots of food choices
column3: Stopped here for a quick bite during our tour. Neat place with plenty of food choices.. Mexican/ seafood/ sushi/ Korean / feel good food in one stop..

This was one of the stops on our tour of LA and we ate lunch here. A Farmer’s Market sounds inexpensive but not here, OMG! They wanted so much for something so simple. I understand the simplicity of it but seriously? 10 dollars for a small sandwich? We had to eat since it was an all day tour so we did it but never again.
This farmersmarket is super expensive and doesn't really have a feel to it. Does have tasty food, but given the price, I'd prefere other spots. But still you should see it to have experienced it!
Awesome place, food is good! You can find food from everywhere, very cheap food here and quality as well.

column2: Have to come back when we have more time
column3: OMG! I was overwhelmed at the choices. You can get pretty much any kind of food here. I wanted to stay longer. Just had time for a glass of wine before having to hop back on the tour bus. Definitely a must do while in Hollywood
This was a complete surprise when wondering the street. Loved all the fresh foods and great atmosphere. If organic foods are your desire this is the place for you.

this is a great farmers market. friendly merchants who love to give out samples. so many items/booths. fruits, vegetables, nuts, honey, jams, flowers, seafood, meats, hot and cold ready to eat food, ethnic foods, etc. oh, and the best homemade pies that would rival your grandmothers. bring along bags as you will buy more then you think. the quality is great. and so is the variety.

As part of a tour group, this was one of the stops. My wife and I found this a nice stop in what was a full day. It was a very clean place with plenty of rest rooms as well as many choices to grab a coffee or something to eat. Lots of shops selling fruits, nuts, sweets, t-shirts, ice cream and so much more. It's not a big place but it filled in a couple of hours.

This market has everything for the person who loves these kind of attractions as you travel around America. A wonderful assortments of stalls with foods of many nationalities, along with specialty shops and a movie theatre making it such a pleasure to take leisurely stroll through on a weekend afternoon. Just loved it and so will you!
Love visiting the farmers market good food great shopping great selection and always fresh produce always got a good crowd too

Its hard to pass up a good market when your traveling and in need of food. The Hollywood Farmers market was a great source to get local food and products. It is also good for just walking around and enjoying the sites.
Hard to park but some vendors will validate ticket. Lots of food options, very busy on a Sunday. All kinds of stores for shopping and farmers market has tons to offer.
Lots of great fruit and veggies that California is known for. Also, lots of interesting fast food and beverages. Next to upscale shopping at the Grove.

I can't think of a better way to spend a Sunday when in the LA area--and I live here.No, the prices the farmers charge is often as much, or more, than the grocery stores. But the produce is superb. Tons of great baked goods. Honey. Food stands. You name it.Well worth the visit

If you want to experience local LA, then the Hollywood Farmers Market on Sundays is well worth a visit! It's much larger than I expected. Lots of great produce, artisan products and food vendors. You gotta try one of the excellent tamales from Corn Maiden! There were 8+ to choose from.

column2: Sunday mornings at the Hollywood Farmers Market
column3: My vegetarian wife prefers to cook with fresh, local, organic produce, so we drive to the Hollywood Farmers Market every Sunday morning. I've grown to love the experience and recommend it to tourists and travelers. The market is the historic core of Hollywood, within site of the Hollywood sign. The market is bordered by Hollywood and Sunset Boulevards to the north and south, and Vine and Cahuenga on the east west. It runs from 8 am to 2 pm every Sunday. By far the best time to go is early - you can park and walk through the market as early as 7:30 am, and that's the best time to stroll around the market, see the Walk of Fame, check out other historic attractions, and grab breakfast. The farmers, who come from all over southern and central California, are still setting up, but they're happy to sell and talk to you about their family farm or orchard. You can sample fresh fruit samples or eat at the many food vendor stalls. This is also the best time to catch celebrity chefs or sleepy rock stars or film/tv stars who have wandered down from the Hollywood Hills to get their fruits and vegetables before the crowds arrive. (More likely, they send their personal chefs.)The market is truly in the heart of historic Hollywood and it's a relaxed time of morning to stroll around and see the Hollywood Walk of Fame or other attractions. There are plenty of Apps and websites for the Walk of Fame. As a music lover, I'm always amazed at the musical history of the area. The famous Sound Factory is in the middle of the market, and a nearby coffee shop (corner of Selma and Cahuenga) has a plaque for Wally Heider's recording studio used to be. Between the two studios, many of the most famous rock stars and bands of all time have recorded there - The Rolling Stones, The Doors, The Who, Beach Boys, CSNY, Fleetwood Mac, Jimi Hendrix and more. Two doors up Cahuenga, look for the sidewalk marker in front of Kitchen 24, at 1608 N. Cahuenga, which used to host a famous jazz club owned by drummer Shelly Manne in the 60s. Look these places up on the web before you visit.Be prepared for an eclectic group of people ranging from hipsters to the homeless. You might spot a star without makeup or a celebrity chef, but don't stare. It's pretty relaxed here in the early morning, but it will soon get crowded.Above all, enjoy the incredible bounty of California agriculture and feel the pride of local growers and family farms. There's a wide range or organic fruit and produce here. You will feel healthy and vibrant just strolling through the market stars on an early Sunday morning.
